newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-TAYLOR HITS 61 AS AUSTRALIANS DOMINATE.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-TAYLOR HITS 61 AS AUSTRALIANS DOMINATE.

text.p: Captain Mark Taylor continued his return to form with an unbeaten 61 as Australia dominated the opening day of their three-day match against Hampshire on Saturday.

Taylor shared an opening partnership of 95 with test opener Matthew Elliott, who fell to the off-spin of Shaun Udal for 61. Greg Blewett was run out for two but Mark Waugh stayed to reach 25 not out as the Australians reached 157 for two by the close.
Earlier, Hampshire's decision to bat first after winning the toss looked a distinctly poor one as they slumped to 93 for eight at lunch.
Former England batsman Robin Smith made 22 and Hampshire scrambled to 156 all out thanks to a battling 31 not out from their wicketkeeper Adrian Aymes.

Michael Kasprowicz took three for 33, including the wicket of Hampshire's Australian import Matthew Hayden for six. Leg-spinner Shane Warne removed three for 30 while Jason Gillespie, back from a hamstring injury, collected two for 65.
